result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador Villalobos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salvador Villalobos

records.addlTxt: 10:17 AM Defendant Salvador Villalobos in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Salvador Villalobos.  Victims mother makes statement to the Court.  State argues conditions.  Attorney Jakobson argues for their recommendation.  11:05 Attorney Oswald appears for the state.
Plea hearing on May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Addendum

9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Salvador Villalobos appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Salvador Villalobos. 

State has filed a motion for other acts evidence.  Court questions Attorney Knaapen regarding the timeliness of the filing.  Attorney Jakobson makes a statement.  

Court finds that the motion for other acts evidence has been filed timely and will proceed with the motion today. Attorney Knaapen gives his argument in support of the motion.  Attorney Jakobson argues in opposition.  Attorney Knaapen gives additional argument.  

Court grants the motion for other acts evidence. 

Attorney Jakobson requests that the Court be prohibited from adding additional witnesses.  Attorney Knaapen opposes. Attorney Jakobson responds.  

Court denies the defendant's motion.
for Admission of Other Acts Evidence

11:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Salvador Villalobos appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Salvador Villalobos. Attorney Jakobson brings a motion to amend the $10,000 cash bond.  Attorney Lambert opposes.  

Court denies the motion to amend bond.  Bond is continued.
State's Jury Instruction Checklist
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Witness list - plaintiff
Jury trial - 12 person on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on April 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for a Speedy Trial

02:52 PM Defendant Salvador Villalobos in court with attorney Oren Jakobson.  Defendant Salvador Villalobos in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Libby Abel is sworn and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. Testifies to meeting with an alleged victim of sexual assault.  Testifies to the specifics of the assault.  Testifies to meeting with the defendant at the police station.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom on video.  Testifies to executing a search warrant for DNA from the defendant.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jakobson.  Questions witness regarding the location of the alleged sexual assault.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued. 

Attorney Jakobson will submit a speedy trial request in writing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Bound over to branch 1 for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.
